detail_copy:
Pevely, Missouri's Federated Auto Parts Raceway at I-55 just might be your favorite driver's favorite dirt track. The third-mile clay oval has played host to the World of Outlaws almost every year since 1987, and frequently attracts some of the biggest names in the sport - even ones who don't normally make their living on the dirt - to compete. The track features 19 degrees of banking in the corners and 10 degrees on its straightaways.

I-55 was purchased by NASCAR legend and Missouri native Ken Schrader in 2003, and fellow Missourian Kenny Wallace is a mainstay of the track as well. In May 2020, shortly after staging one of the first real-world racing events in America after the COVID-19 pandemic began, Kyle Larson set the track record and broke the 10-second mark in a World of Outlaws Sprint Car. Now's your chance to see if you can match that kind of speed in the virtual world.
